item.title: 赫斯-雪佛龙合并案投票时机似乎已成熟，将以微弱优势获得批准
item.description: 赫斯公司（Hess Corp）首席执行官约翰-赫斯（John Hess）必须在本周二之前平息股东对他处理可能成为石油行业历史上最大兼并案之一的处理方式的不满：拟以 530 亿美元的价格将这家石油生产商出售给雪佛龙公司（Chevron Corp.【原文：Hess Corp CEO John Hess has until Tuesday to quell a rebellion by shareholders over his handling of what could turn out to be one of the largest mergers in oil industry history: a proposed $53 billion sale of the oil producer to Chevron Corp .】

item.title: 美国公司最大的一些分裂
item.description: 化学制造商杜邦公司宣布了一项将公司拆分为三家上市公司的计划，成为最新一家拆分业务的跨国公司。【原文：Chemical maker DuPont has become the latest multinational to break up its business, announcing a plan to split the firm into three publicly traded companies.】

item.title: 美国批评波兰广播监管机构对 TVN Style 的处理方式
item.description: 美国驻波兰大使周四批评波兰广播监管机构质疑美国公司 TVN Style 的所有权结构。【原文：The US ambassador to Poland on Thursday criticised the country's broadcast regulator for questioning the ownership structure of US company TVN Style.】

item.title: 首席执行官巴拉支持通用汽车推动自动驾驶汽车发展
item.description: 通用汽车公司首席执行官玛丽-巴拉（Mary Barra）周四在底特律经济俱乐部（Detroit Economic Club）的一次活动上支持底特律汽车制造商为制造自动驾驶汽车所做的努力。【原文：General Motors' CEO Mary Barra backed the Detroit automaker's efforts towards building autonomous vehicles at a Detroit Economic Club event on Thursday.】

item.title: 阿霍德德尔海兹将关闭业绩不佳的美国 Stop & Shop 商店
item.description: 超市集团阿霍德-德尔海兹（Ahold Delhaize）周四表示，今年将在美国关闭一批业绩不佳的 Stop & Shop 杂货店，具体数量未透露。【原文：Supermarket group Ahold Delhaize said on Thursday it will close an undisclosed number of underperforming Stop & Shop grocery stores in the U.S. this year.】

item.title: 汇丰银行纽约新办事处的出席率跃升至 80
item.description: 汇丰银行美国和美洲区首席执行官迈克尔-罗伯茨（Michael Roberts）周四表示，汇丰银行位于纽约哈德逊码区的新办公室的员工出勤率已跃升至 80%。【原文：HSBC's employee attendance has jumped to 80% at its new office in New York's Hudson Yards area, said Michael Roberts, CEO of HSBC in the USA and the Americas, on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国 30 年期固定利率抵押贷款降至 7% 以下
item.description: 本周，美国流行的 30 年期抵押贷款平均利率一个多月来首次跌破 7%，这可能有助于重振房地产市场的颓势。【原文：The average rate on the popular U.S. 30-year mortgage rate fell below 7% this week for the first time in more than a month, which could help revive the housing market's waning fortunes.】

item.title: Orsted 获得摩根大通 6.5 亿美元的税收股权融资
item.description: 丹麦清洁能源开发商 Orsted 周四表示，该公司已从摩根大通（J.P. Morgan）获得 6.8 亿美元的税股权融资投资，用于德克萨斯州和亚利桑那州的太阳能和储能资产组合。【原文：Danish company Orsted has secured an investment of $680 million in tax equity financing from J.P. Morgan for a portfolio of solar and storage assets in Texas and Arizona, the clean energy developer said on Thursday.】

item.title: 英国科技公司创始人迈克-林奇将在美国就惠普交易案出庭作证
item.description: 曾被誉为英国史蒂夫-乔布斯（Steve Jobs）的科技公司创始人迈克-林奇（Mike Lynch）将于周四在旧金山联邦法院出庭为自己辩护，他被控在惠普公司以 110 亿美元收购他的公司的交易中诈骗，对他的审判即将结束。【原文：Mike Lynch, the tech founder once hailed as Britain's answer to Steve Jobs, will take the stand in his own defense on Thursday in San Francisco federal court as his trial on charges of bilking Hewlett-Packard in an $11 billion deal to acquire his company nears its end.】

item.title: 美国司法部起诉拆散 Live Nation 和 Ticketmaster
item.description: 美国司法部与由 30 个州和哥伦比亚特区组成的团体于周四提起诉讼，要求解散 Live Nation，认为该音乐会推广方及其 Ticketmaster 部门非法抬高了音乐会门票价格，损害了艺术家的利益。【原文：The U.S. Justice Department, along with a group of 30 states and the District of Columbia, filed a lawsuit to break up Live Nation on Thursday, arguing the concert promoter and its Ticketmaster unit illegally inflated concert ticket prices and hurt artists.】

item.title: 特斯拉投资者苏格兰抵押贷款支持马斯克 560 亿美元薪酬方案
item.description: 特斯拉投资者苏格兰抵押贷款投资信托公司（Scottish Mortgage Investment Trust）周四表示，该公司计划在下月举行的年度股东大会上继续支持首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）560亿美元的薪酬方案。【原文：Tesla investor Scottish Mortgage Investment trust said on Thursday it plans to continue backing CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package at its annual shareholder meeting next month.】

item.title: 埃隆-马斯克：我反对针对电动汽车的税收激励措施
item.description: 特斯拉创始人埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）周四告诉聚集在巴黎的科技投资者，他反对任何有利于电动汽车的税收优惠或关税，就像他反对为石油和天然气提供优惠一样。【原文：Tesla founder Elon Musk on Thursday told tech investors gathered in Paris that he was against any tax incentives or tariffs that favour electric cars, just as he was against benefits for oil and gas.】

item.title: 由于交付量持续低迷，波音公司目前认为 2024 年的自由现金流为负值
item.description: 波音公司财务总监周四表示，波音公司将在2024年烧钱而不是产生现金，第二季度的交付量也不会增加，因为这家美国飞机制造商正在努力应对一场全面的危机，这场危机正在抑制其销量最大的飞机的生产。【原文：Boeing will burn rather than generate cash in 2024 and deliveries will not increase in the second quarter, the company's finance chief said Thursday, as the U.S. planemaker grapples with a full-blown crisis that is pinching production of its strongest-selling aircraft.】

item.title: 德国问题增多，投资者热捧法国
item.description: 65 年来，德国电气元件制造商哈格一直横跨莱茵河，在两岸都设有生产基地，但最近，这家家族企业选择在法国一侧实施扩张计划。【原文：For 65 years German electrical components maker Hager has straddled the Rhine with sites on either side, but lately the family-owned group has plumped for the French side to host its expansion plans.】

item.title: 美国 4 月新屋销售下降；价格环比上涨
item.description: 在抵押贷款利率回升和房价上涨的影响下，4 月份美国新建独栋住宅的销量降幅超过预期，进一步证明第二季度房地产市场正在失去动力。【原文：Sales of new U.S. single-family homes fell more than expected in April amid a resurgence in mortgage rates and higher prices, further evidence that the housing market was losing momentum in the second quarter.】

item.title: 特斯拉在影响报告中不再提及每年交付 2,000 万辆汽车的目标
item.description: 特斯拉周四发布的最新影响报告中没有包括其之前制定的到 2030 年每年交付 2000 万辆汽车的目标，这是该公司在将重点转向机器人轴时缩减其汽车雄心的又一迹象。【原文：Tesla's latest impact report published on Thursday does not include its previously laid down target to deliver 20 million vehicles a year by 2030, another sign the company was scaling back its auto ambitions as it shifts focus to robotaxis.】

item.title: 美国起诉打破 Live Nation-Ticketmaster 的 "垄断
item.description: 美国司法部和由 30 个州及哥伦比亚特区组成的团体周四起诉解散 Live Nation 公司，认为这家大型音乐会推广商及其 Ticketmaster 部门非法抬高音乐会门票价格，损害了艺术家的利益。【原文：The U.S. Justice Department and a group of 30 states and the District of Columbia Thursday sued to break up Live Nation , arguing the big concert promoter and its Ticketmaster unit illegally inflated concert ticket prices and hurt artists.】

item.title: 独家：消息人士称，哈格里夫斯-兰斯当最大股东对公司私有化持开放态度
item.description: 三位熟悉此事的人士告诉路透社，英国零售投资平台 Hargreaves Lansdown 的最大股东彼得-哈格里夫斯（Peter Hargreaves）对将公司私有化持开放态度，并在近期与投资者就交易事宜进行了会谈。【原文：Peter Hargreaves, the biggest shareholder in UK retail investment platform Hargreaves Lansdown , is open to taking the company private and has held talks with investors recently about a transaction, three people familiar with the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 美国 5 月商业活动加快；价格压力增大
item.description: 5 月份，美国商业活动加速增长，达到两年多来的最高水平，但制造商报告称，一系列投入品的价格飙升，这表明未来几个月商品通胀可能回升。【原文：U.S. business activity accelerated to the highest level in just over two years in May, but manufacturers reported a surge in prices for a range of inputs, suggesting that goods inflation could pick up in the months ahead.】

item.title: 拜登加班工资规定遭美国商业团体质疑
item.description: 美国商业团体联盟提起诉讼，要求阻止拜登政府将强制性加班工资扩大到 400 万工人的规定，称该规定太过分了。【原文：A coalition of U.S. business groups has filed a lawsuit seeking to block a Biden administration rule that would extend mandatory overtime pay to 4 million workers, saying it goes too far.】

item.title: 中国阿里巴巴将通过发行可转换债券融资 45 亿美元
item.description: 阿里巴巴集团控股公司周四表示，将出售 45 亿美元的可转换优先票据，并计划使用部分收益回购美国存托股票。【原文：Alibaba Group Holding said on Thursday it would sell $4.5 billion in convertible senior notes and plans to repurchase American Depositary Shares using some of the proceeds.】

item.title: 消息人士称，信实和迪斯尼寻求印度反垄断点头，并保证板球版权
item.description: 两位直接知情人士告诉路透社，信实工业公司和华特迪斯尼公司已为其 85 亿美元的印度媒体合并案申请反垄断许可，理由是双方的综合实力，尤其是在板球转播方面的综合实力，不会对广告商造成冲击。【原文：Reliance Industries and Walt Disney have sought antitrust clearance for their $8.5 billion India media merger by arguing their combined power, especially on cricket broadcasting, will not hit advertisers, two people with direct knowledge told Reuters.】

item.title: 日本央行上田坚持经济复苏观点，保留加息机会
item.description: 日本央行行长上田一夫周四表示，日本经济正处于温和复苏的轨道上，并暗示仅凭第一季度国内生产总值（GDP）的下滑不会阻止央行在未来几个月内加息。【原文：Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda said on Thursday the economy was on track for a moderate recovery, suggesting a slump in first-quarter gross domestic product (GDP) alone would not keep the central bank from raising interest rates in coming months.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利执行董事长詹姆斯-戈尔曼将于年底卸任
item.description: 摩根士丹利执行董事长詹姆斯-戈尔曼（James Gorman）在该行年度股东大会上表示，他将于 12 月 31 日卸任。【原文：Morgan Stanley's executive chairman James Gorman will step down on Dec. 31, he told the bank's annual shareholder meeting.】

item.title: 报告显示，美国 5 月汽车销量将小幅增长
item.description: 据行业咨询公司J.D. Power和GlobalData周四联合发布的报告称，受跨界SUV和皮卡需求的推动，预计5月份美国新车销量将环比增长。【原文：New vehicle sales in the United States are projected to rise in May from a year earlier, helped by demand for crossover SUVs and pickup trucks, according to a joint report by industry consultants J.D. Power and GlobalData on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国每周申请失业救济人数下降，劳动力市场保持稳健
item.description: 上周新申请失业救济的美国人数量有所下降，这表明劳动力市场的基本实力应能继续支撑经济。【原文：The number of Americans filing new claims for unemployment benefits fell last week, pointing to underlying strength in the labor market that should continue to support the economy.】

item.title: 民意调查 全球股市牛市疲态尽显，但预计不会出现回调
item.description: 路透社对股票分析师进行的一项调查显示，全球股市牛市正在显现出疲态，大多数主要股指预计不会重现去年的辉煌表现，这些分析师还表示，近期不太可能出现回调。【原文：The global equity bull run is showing signs of fatigue, with most major stock indexes not expected to repeat last year's stellar performance, according to a Reuters poll of stock analysts who also said a near-term correction was unlikely.】

item.title: 拉尔夫-劳伦任命 Justin Picicci 为首席财务官，预计年收入将下滑
item.description: 拉尔夫-劳伦（Ralph Lauren）周四预测年度收入增长低于市场预期，并任命 Justin Picicci 接替 Jane Nielsen 担任首席财务官。【原文：Ralph Lauren on Thursday forecast annual revenue growth below market expectations and named Justin Picicci as its chief financial officer succeeding Jane Nielsen.】

item.title: 更多投资者涌入新兴市场，掩盖了新兴市场资金外流的事实
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America）的一位资深经济学家告诉路透社记者，大资金投资者开始将更多现金投放到新兴市场，因为他们追求回报，这可能是他们资金分配方式的结构性转变。【原文：Big-money investors are beginning to place more cash in emerging markets as they chase returns in what could be a structural shift in the way they allocate their money, a veteran Bank of America economist told Reuters.】

item.title: 英伟达首席执行官黄仁勋预计人工智能生成的视频将推动对其芯片的更多需求
item.description: 对于芯片设计公司英伟达（Nvidia）来说，人工智能的蓬勃发展是一份源源不断的礼物。【原文：For chip designer Nvidia , the generative artificial intelligence boom is the gift that keeps on giving.】
